TEXT.English: The demon Hyborem has been vanquished, and his soul sent screaming back into the pits of Hell. His weapon, the unholy Gela, is all that remains of the mighty demon. Your forces, victorious, reach to claim the weapon that has been left behind. But it is up to you to decide what will become of this demonic legacy.

TEXT.English: I shall keep the weapon. It's strength shall become my own.
TEXT.French: I shall keep the weapon. It's strength shall become my own.
TEXT.German: I shall keep the weapon. It's strength shall become my own.
TEXT.Italian: I shall keep the weapon. It's strength shall become my own.
TEXT.Spanish: I shall keep the weapon. It's strength shall become my own.

TEXT.English: The demonic taint must be washed from this trident. I shall cleanse it in the waters of the Pool of Tears.
TEXT.French: The demonic taint must be washed from this trident. I shall cleanse it in the waters of the Pool of Tears.

TEXT.Spanish: The demonic taint must be washed from this trident. I shall cleanse it in the waters of the Pool of Tears.

TEXT.English: The Gela must be disposed of quickly. I shall hurl it into the great Maelstrom, banishing it to the ocean floor.
TEXT.French: The Gela must be disposed of quickly. I shall hurl it into the great Maelstrom, banishing it to the ocean floor.
TEXT.German: The Gela must be disposed of quickly. I shall hurl it into the great Maelstrom, banishing it to the ocean floor.

TEXT.English: Only the angels of Basium will know how to handle this. I shall entrust the Gela to their care and bring it to their Gate.
TEXT.French: Only the angels of Basium will know how to handle this. I shall entrust the Gela to their care and bring it to their Gate.

TEXT.English: The Gela must be destroyed! I shall hurl it into the fires of Pyre of the Seraphic.
TEXT.French: The Gela must be destroyed! I shall hurl it into the fires of Pyre of the Seraphic.
TEXT.German: The Gela must be destroyed! I shall hurl it into the fires of Pyre of the Seraphic.

TEXT.Spanish: The Gela must be destroyed! I shall hurl it into the fires of Pyre of the Seraphic.

TEXT.English: The Gela contains much demonic power. Perhaps I can harness it using the necromantic texts found in the Broken Sepulcher.
TEXT.French: The Gela contains much demonic power. Perhaps I can harness it using the necromantic texts found in the Broken Sepulcher.

TEXT.Spanish: The Gela contains much demonic power. Perhaps I can harness it using the necromantic texts found in the Broken Sepulcher.

TEXT.English: Perhaps the Gela can be used for good, if properly energized. I shall let it soak up the holy power of the Sun at the Mirror of Heaven. But it will take time.
TEXT.French: Perhaps the Gela can be used for good, if properly energized. I shall let it soak up the holy power of the Sun at the Mirror of Heaven. But it will take time.

TEXT.English: The Maelstrom consumes the trident quickly and, miraculously, the waves grow calm. A moment passes as the swirling vortex begins again. Out of the center walks a man with bowed head, wearing the robes of a priest. He is accompanied by four attendants. The Overlords must be pleased.

TEXT.English: The ship is sacrificed and sucked into the turbulent vortex of the whirlpool. A moment passes, and then the seas turn red. A storm begins brewing on the horizon. Something is not right.

TEXT.English: Pike of Tears
TEXT.French: Pike of Tears
TEXT.German: Pike of Tears
TEXT.Italian: Pike of Tears
TEXT.Spanish: Pike of Tears

TEXT.English: The Gela is plunged into the cold waters of the Pool of Tears. The demonic taint washes off from the weapon in waves of oily blackness, mixing with the spring. The Gela is no more, and in its place an even more powerful weapon has been created. But at what cost?

TEXT.English: The demon tainted water is carried far and wide throughout the land. The world suffers, as do the people of Erebus.
TEXT.French: The demon tainted water is carried far and wide throughout the land. The world suffers, as do the people of Erebus.

TEXT.English: Standing before the holy Gate of the Mercurians, the mighty Basium looks down upon you. You offer up the Gela, and the angel's massive hand reaches down to take it. "You have done well to rid Erebus of the demon Hyborem. The angels shall sing your name in praise. But there is still much corruption in this land. Take one of my finest newly reborn warriors to aid you in your battle."

TEXT.English: The Gela is hurled into the flames, which seem to flicker and burn eagerly for the demonic object. The fires die down for a moment before flaring into an intensity that scorches the ceiling of the great temple. Then, miraculously, the flames stop moving and grow black. A piercing cry fills the Pyre, and looking into the flame one can now see the tortured souls used to forge the trident wailing in despair.

TEXT.English: The Gela is hurled into the flames, which seem to flicker and burn eagerly for the demonic object. The weapon hisses for a brief moment and then, for the first time since it was lit, the fires burn out. The very earth screams out in protest at the magical energies unleashed by the destruction of Gela. The ley lines leading to the Pyre, once invisible to the naked eye, are suddenly illuminated by the energy surging through them. The phenomenon fades, and the temple now lies in ruins.

TEXT.English: Using the necromantic texts found in the libraries left behind by Barbatos, you learn how to twist the demonic powers of the Gela to your will. This ritual will unravel the unholy markings of the weapon, allowing you to guide the spirits of the recently departed away from Hell and into your own kingdom. It requires thousands of sacrifices. You are fairly certain you have enough willing subjects.

TEXT.English: Your people place the Gela in the center of the Mirror of Heaven. Inky black smoke begins to rise from the weapon in plumes as the sun purifies it. After a while, the weapon ceases to smoke, and the light of the Mirror shines brilliantly off of its surface. The taint is removed, and in its place a holy trident of great power remains. This has surely attracted the attention of any demons nearby but your unit needs some time to control the power of the trident.

TEXT.English: A strange adept has recently joined the mage guild of %s2_city. While the student is incredibly smart and talented, all the other students and even some of the instructors steer clear of him. Many claim he delves deeply in necromancy and dark arts, some have observed strange experiments, and everyone says that anyone who gets in his way often falls victim to some strange circumstance.

TEXT.English: Dark arts? Expel him from our country, he is not welcome here!
TEXT.French: Dark arts? Expel him from our country, he is not welcome here!

TEXT.English: A band of haggard refugees has shown up outside %s2_city. The leader of the group says that they had stumbled upon the true nature of the Ashen Veil religion, much to the chagrin of the higher-ups in their nation. Not wanting to live in Hell, assist it in any way, or become the next demonic sacrifice for what they know, they had no choice but to flee. They seek refuge in a land where they can live free of Hell's taint, and if possible, fight back.

TEXT.English: While on patrol, your unit stumbles across the laboratory of an isolated golem-maker. As the golem-maker greets you, you see a strange, crazed glint in his eye. Some of the half-finished golems that you can see lying around appear disturbingly...biological. "Welcome," the golem-maker says. "I could use another deft pair of hands for my experiments. My golem assistants are strong, but they lack manual dexterity. Will you help me?"

TEXT.English: The Lord of Murder has chosen us to be his children. Let us rejoice in the power he grants us over the weak.

TEXT.German: The Lord of Murder has chosen us to be his children. Let us rejoice in the power he grants us over the weak.

TEXT.English: Astrologers report that the Shroud has moved into prominence. This constellation is sacred to Arawn and it is said to be a good time to visit gravesites and remember those that have passed on. Although The God of Death himself does nothing to honor this alignment, his archangel Gyra works to make sure that the dead may rest in peace.
TEXT.French: Astrologers report that the Shroud has moved into prominence. This constellation is sacred to Arawn and it is said to be a good time to visit gravesites and remember those that have passed on. Although The God of Death himself does nothing to honor this alignment, his archangel Gyra works to make sure that the dead may rest in peace.
TEXT.German: Eure Sterndeuter berichten, dass das Leichentuch den Nachthimmel beherrscht. Dieses Sternbild ist Arawn geweiht und es heit, dass dies eine gute Zeit sei, um Grabsttten zu besuchen und den Verblichenen zu gedenken. Although The God of Death himself does nothing to honor this alignment, his archangel Gyra works to make sure that the dead may rest in peace.

TEXT.English: Let us honor the Lord of the Otherworld, though he cares not what we do in this life.
